website_summaries.verdict: The Tivoli Model Three is a great tabletop radio, but the built-in alarm clock falls short of the digital competition.
pros: auxiliary line-in (doubles as an iPod speaker)
optional companion speaker available for stereo sound

customer_reviews.title: I like this product enormously
customer_reviews.text: I like this product enormously. We wanted an analog interface that was intuitive and simple. We wanted knobs instead of buttons. And this is a very easy clock radio to manipulate with excellent sound and a fun bluetooth connection. That may or may not be worth $300 to you, but it was to us.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Paley

customer_reviews.title: Not a keeper, lacking features, can't read the writing
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly on time and worked when plugged in. OK sound and FM tuner sensitivity and bluetooth. Now for the not so good: This item does not have dual alarm, nor usb charging, the cherry is very dry and of poor quality, and the front and rear panel graphics are so faint that it is almost impossible to read even with bright lighting, much fainter than in the website photos. Very hard to read in a bedroom. Returning it today for a more functional, less expensive option.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Strong on sound.  Weak on UI.
customer_reviews.text: I have very mixed feelings about this product. High marks for sound quality. Bluetooth capability is a nice add on. Beautifully designed. But, everything about the UI is terrible. Can't read the print on the face of the radio. Who ever dreamed up blue print on a black background? The clock loses time and needs to be adjusted on a daily basis. The alarm can't be set on AM, so you have to turn it off and turn it back on every day. Lots more complaints, but you get the gist.
customer_reviews.author: ChelseaYogi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing radio reception that will LIGHT UP YOUR BEDROOM like a Christmas Tree....
customer_reviews.text: Way Overpriced. but gets excellent reception and quality sound. The PROBLEM is that there are 3 or 4 LED lights on the front of the unit and when you add the light on the clock, it lights up the bedroom like a Christmas tree. Not a good bedroom edition. It is an amazing radio however. I own two of the non clock models and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: High quality radio
customer_reviews.text: High quality radio. It has great sound, even in mono mode - and very easy on the eyes . For the first time, I'm receiving a perfect FM signal from a station 40 mi. away and another from 100 mi. away (strong at certain times of the day). This radio is used out in the country. The quirks of clock and alarm are not too hard to live with - with my routine. It has me enjoying music, just before sleep and after the alarm, so I guess the upside outweighs the other factors - for me.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BT radio.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent FM stereo blue tooth radio. I own three and love the sound from each.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Rehberg

customer_reviews.title: Not a recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This radio is designed to play in stereo when an extension or companion speaker is connected to the speaker output and the toggle switch is slid to stereo mode from mono. No sound from extension speaker when connected and balance adjusted to equal on both channels. sound in extension speaker was achieved only after resorting back to the mono mode. Seller swears it worked for him. I seriously doubt it. This is the second one I bought from another seller that did the dame thing. Not a recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jet

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound. Nice look
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a Tivoli. Bought 1 of each type. Nice sound. Nice look. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ohnesorg

customer_reviews.title: Good analog clock radio
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to find a clock radio with an analog clock. The one I had before this one was much bigger and broke within a year. This one is more expensive but has a much better sound quality and is a nice size. The only thing that I would change would be to be able to dim the clock illumination.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound is not good and the reception is neither
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Tivoli's before and this one is not up to past standards.Sound is not good and the reception is neither.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT HUNT

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, very functional and fun to look at
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it for the functionality of the clock, the alarms and the Tivoli Audio sound, and it looks pretty cool too. My wife loves this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Newtons 3rd Law

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, little else
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Model Three for at least 10 years. It gets 5 stars for sound quality. the older model only has 1 input. It gets 2 stars as an alarm clock. The lights are not dimmable and it way to bright for the bedroom. The alarm is hard to set, and is old fashioned 12 hour, and to set the alarm earlier time you have to rotate it all the way around. The clock is hard to set and isn't 100% accurate. So it sits on my nightstand with my android tablet in front of it as a shield from the lights and is the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Talbert

customer_reviews.title: Good: Radio works well and the sound quality is ...
customer_reviews.text: Good: Radio works well and the sound quality is excellent for the size of the unit. Bad: The alarm has never worked; even worse, it goes off at the wrong time. The clock face is very difficult to read, as the minute and hour hands are almost the same size and hard to distinguish. Bluetooth needs to be paired every time you use it. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Solid ,compact, style.
customer_reviews.text: Found one at Goodwill for $3.99. Sounds fantastic. I love the compact style. And hey, did I mention that I paid $3.99?
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rogers
